parameters.content:
## Backup n8n Credentials (encrypted with pgp) to GitHub 

:warning: **WARNING :warning:
CREDENTIALS ARE ENCRYPTET
by a PGP key you have to create yourself

This workflow will backup all Credentials of the User to GitHub on schedule

The files are saved into folders using `$N8N_HOST` (from Docker Env) for the directory path and `ID.json` for the filename.


MWa 2025

### Setup
* Install Community Node: [n8n-nodes-pgp](https://www.npmjs.com/package/n8n-nodes-pgp)
* Add your PGP Key (private and public) to credentials
* Setup a [n8n API key](https://docs.n8n.io/api/authentication/) and add it to credentials
* Setup [Github API access token](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/credentials/github/)
* Open `Globals` node and update the values below ðŸ‘‡


- **repo.owner:** your Github username
- **repo.name:** the name of your repository
- **repo.path:** the folder to use within the repository.


If your username was `john-connor` and your repository was called `n8n-backups` and you wanted the credentials to go into a `n8n.example.net/credentials` folder you would set:

- repo.owner - john-connor
- repo.name - n8n-backup
- repo.path - {{$env.N8N_HOST}}workflows/

## Delete old credentials from backup
**Delete credentials that don't exist anymore in n8n

Activate Github Node to use this part

nodes.name: Get all files in given path1

parameters.content:
### Changlog

- 2025-04-17 Initial Version (MWa) 
- 2025-04-21 Added Part to delete crendetials which are deleted from n8n (you can still restore them on GitHub) (MWa)

main.node: Get all files in given path1
Get all files in given path1

name: Backup n8n Credentials to GItHub (PGP encrypted)

* Add your PGP Key (private and public) to credentials
* Setup a [n8n API key](https://docs.n8n.io/api/authentication/) and add it to credentials
* Setup [Github API access token](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/credentials/github/)
* Open `Globals` node and update the values below ðŸ‘‡

- **repo.name:** the name of your repository
- **repo.path:** the folder to use within the repository.


If your username was `john-connor` and your repository was called `n8n-backups` and you wanted the credentials to go into a `n8n.example.net/credentials` folder you would set:

- repo.owner - john-connor
- repo.name - n8n-backup
- repo.path - {{$env.N8N_HOST}}workflows/

## Delete old credentials from backup
**Delete credentials that don't exist anymore in n8n

Activate Github Node to use this part
